page.title: 08Industry: Kilns old & new
page.content: The largest industry in the block is the firm of Timbmet which kiln-dries timber from all over the world and supplies rare woods for repair or renovation of woodwork in historic buildings eg. the Bodleian Library. Its kilns are on the site of the ancient Chawley brickworks where bricks were made by hand until 1940 and a saw mill operated until 1963. About 220 people are employed by the firm. At Farmoor on the edge of the block there is a small panel beating works which carries out car body repairs.
